skillTree.localised_description: The tribes of Albion breed a hardy race of horses, surefooted and fast. But only wealthy warriors may be able to afford to ride into battle.

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

skillTree.localised_description: There is no true peace on Albion. The tribes constantly fight Fimir, the dangers of the blighted island or each other for the sparse resources. Their warriors don't tire easily.
The primitive, often savage-looking talismans of the Albionites still seem to have some protective effects.
Experienced warriors of Albion sometimes dodge missiles with seemingly unnatural reflexes gained from the experience of countless skirmishes.
This Lord belts out orders and can be heard even across a battlefield smothered in the grim noise of war.
Who wants to live forever? As it turns out, most beings wouldn't say no…

effects.description: This Lord will be wounded instead of killed in battle

skillTree.localised_description: Having learned much in their long years of service, this character now turns their attention to training others.

effects.description: Character will share +15% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +20%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +30% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +35%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)
Character will share +50% of experience earned between all other active Lords

Character experience gain: +50%
	(Heroes in Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The first Truthsayers have been taught by the Old Ones themselves. Precious little is left of these original teachings, but even a fraction of this magical knowledge is still potent.

Truthsayers don't write down their knowledge. The secrets are passed from the master's mouth to the pupil's ear, which introduces mistakes and misunderstandings. This causes the magic of the Truthsayers to be less reliable, but some changes introduced this way have unexpected beneficial side-effects.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +30

skillTree.localised_description: Truthsayers have mastered the ability to call ever more terrifying constructs of rotten wood, mud and bones from the swamps to bolster their ranks.

effects.description:
Recruitment rank: +4 for Fenbeasts units
	(Lord's army)

Ward save: 10% for Fenbeasts units
	(Lord's army)

Bonus vs Infantry: +15 for Fenbeasts units
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: It is said that the Giants of Albion were the last gift of the Old Ones to the Truthsayers. Both the tribes and the giants have long since forgotten the truth about the Old Ones, but the alliance still holds strong.

effects.description:
Charge Bonus: +20% for Giants and Half-Giants
	(Lord's army)

Recruitment Rank: +4 for Giants and Half-Giants
	(Lord's army)

Battle Speed: +20% for Giants and Half-Giants
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The Truthsayer conjures a flock of magic birds which will fly straight into the enemy formations, bringing doom to those they collide with.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for Wings of Fate Upgraded
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for Wings of Fate
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for Wings of Fate Upgraded

skillTree.localised_description: The magic of Albion conjures the famous mists of its homeland, enveloping allied warriors, protecting them from projectiles.
The mage calls upon the gods of hunting and battle to grant his allies additional strength and skill.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for Blessing of Valor Upgraded
Winds of Magic cost: -1 for Blessing of Valor
Winds of Magic cost: -2 forBlessing of Valor Upgraded

skillTree.localised_description: The voice of the truthsayer is heard in the minds of his warriors, invoking their sense of honor and giving them unwavering hope even in the most desperate of situations.

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for Boon of Courage Upgraded

attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for Boon of Courage
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for Boon of Courage Upgraded

skillTree.localised_description: A barrier of shimmering light protects the warriors from magic and flame alike.

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -1 for Light of Protection
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for Light of Protection Upgraded

skillTree.localised_description: Dying Warriors are granted a second chance as the spell of the truthsayer mends their deadly wounds and allows them to return to battle.

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for Gift of Life Upgraded

target_if: Hit point replenishment cap not reached

effects.description: Winds of Magic cost: -2 for Gift of Life
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for Gift of Life Upgraded

skillTree.localised_description: The booming voice of the truthsayer fills the mind of an enemy, robbing them of the concentration necessary to operate ranged weapons.

effects.description: Miscast base chance: -15% for Voice of Command Upgraded
Winds of Magic cost: -2 for Voice of Command
Winds of Magic cost: -3 for Voice of Command Upgraded

skillTree.localised_description: By stabbing a staff or some arcane conduit into the ground, an accomplished magic-user can earth or tether the Winds and hopefully reduce a chance of miscasting.
A few magic-users have the ability to store the Winds of Magic for later use, increasing their spellcasting power when it really counts.

effects.description: Winds of Magic power reserve capacity: +5

skillTree.localised_description: There are Lords that radiate power, confidence and fear, inspiring their followers to great or terrible acts.

effects.description:
Unit experience gain per turn: +75
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Every able member of the tribes of Albion is trained in the use of at least one weapon to be able to fend off the daily dangers of the blighted lands.
Only the best and most accomplished warriors may join the ranks of the Oathsworn and become the personal guards of Petty Chieftains and Overkings.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +4 for Oathsworn, Highlanders and Chosen of Ishernos
	(Lord's army)

Ward Save: +3 for Oathsworn, Highlanders and Chosen of Ishernos
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +4 for Oathsworn, Highlanders and Chosen of Ishernos
	(Lord's army)

Ward Save: +5 for Oathsworn, Highlanders and Chosen of Ishernos
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +6 for Oathsworn, Highlanders and Chosen of Ishernos
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Many deadly abominations lure in the mists which shroud Albion, ready to defend it from any intruders.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +4 for Fenbeasts, Giants, Aitheach Giant-Blooded, Zoats, Ogham Barrow Wights and Fenhulks
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +7 for Fenbeasts, Giants, Aitheach Giant-Blooded, Zoats, Ogham Barrow Wights and Fenhulks
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +4 for Fenbeasts, Giants, Aitheach Giant-Blooded, Zoats, Ogham Barrow Wights and Fenhulks
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +15 for Fenbeasts, Giants, Aitheach Giant-Blooded, Zoats, Ogham Barrow Wights and Fenhulks
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +6 for Fenbeasts, Giants, Aitheach Giant-Blooded, Zoats, Ogham Barrow Wights and Fenhulks
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Primitive they may be, but their unrivalled wildness and savage might easily make up for the lack of refinement.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +4 for Woad Raiders, Druidic Initiates and Maidenguard
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +6% for Woad Raiders, Druidic Initiates and Maidenguard
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +6 for Woad Raiders, Druidic Initiates and Maidenguard
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +12% for Woad Raiders, Druidic Initiates and Maidenguard
	(Lord's army)

Melee Attack: +8 for Woad Raiders, Druidic Initiates and Maidenguard
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The hunt is part of the daily life of most inhabitants of Albion and the hunters joining the armies have steady arms and good eyes, sharpened by years of experience.

effects.description:
Missile Damage: +4% for Giant (Stone Thrower), Young Slingers, Huntresses, Llenog Catapult, and Hobelars (Javelins)
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +10% for Giant (Stone Thrower), Young Slingers, Huntresses, Llenog Catapult, and Hobelars (Javelins)
	(Lord's army)

Missile Damage: +6% for Giant (Stone Thrower), Young Slingers, Huntresses, Llenog Catapult, and Hobelars (Javelins)
	(Lord's army)

Ammunition: +20% for Giant (Stone Thrower), Young Slingers, Huntresses, Llenog Catapult, and Hobelars (Javelins)
	(Lord's army)

Missile Damage: +8% for Giant (Stone Thrower), Young Slingers, Huntresses, Llenog Catapult, and Hobelars (Javelins)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hit before the enemy can defend themselves, be gone before they can hit back.

effects.description:
Battle Speed: +6% Hunting Dogs, Hobelars, Chariots, Feral Gryphons and Centaurs
	(Lord's army)

Battle Speed: +9% Hunting Dogs, Hobelars, Chariots, Feral Gryphons and Centaurs
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +6 Hunting Dogs, Hobelars, Chariots, Feral Gryphons and Centaurs
	(Lord's army)

	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +12 Hunting Dogs, Hobelars, Chariots, Feral Gryphons and Centaurs
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: The best way to kill a foe is a well aimed arrow or boulder, killing them before they even know what happened.

effects.description:
Missile Damage: +12% for Giant (Stone Thrower), Young Slingers, Huntresses, Llenog Catapult, and Hobelars (Javelins) (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Reload Speed: +10% for Giant (Stone Thrower), Young Slingers, Huntresses, Llenog Catapult, and Hobelars (Javelins) (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Missile Resistance: +15% Giant (Stone Thrower), Young Slingers, Huntresses, Llenog Catapult, and Hobelars (Javelins) (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Druids with magical powers and mystical beasts belong to the most feared members of any Albion warband, and rightly so.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +5 for Fenbeasts, Giants, Aitheach Giant-Blooded, Zoats, Fenhulks, Centaurs, Ogham Barrow Wights, Feral Gryphons and Druidic Initiates (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +12% for Fenbeasts, Giants, Aitheach Giant-Blooded, Zoats, Fenhulks, Centaurs, Ogham Barrow Wights, Feral Gryphons and Druidic Initiates (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Melee Defence: +5 for Fenbeasts, Giants, Aitheach Giant-Blooded, Zoats, Fenhulks, Centaurs, Ogham Barrow Wights, Feral Gryphons and Druidic Initiates (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: With a combination of speed, agility and brutal savagery the defenders of Albion often seem more like a wave of flesh and steel, breaking their enemies in the charge and washing them away in a tide of blood.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +5 for Woad Raiders, Maidenguard, Centaurs, Hunting Dogs and Hobelars (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Charge Bonus: +12 for Woad Raiders, Maidenguard, Albion Chariots, Hunting Dogs and Hobelars (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Weapon Strength: +12% for Woad Raiders, Maidenguard, Albion Chariots, Hunting Dogs and Hobelars (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: Hardened in many battles against the constant threats emerging from the bogs of the island, these veterans have superior skills compared to inexperienced troops.

effects.description:
Melee Attack: +5 for Warbands, Oathsworn, Highlanders and Chosen of Ishernos (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Armour: +12 for Warbands, Oathsworn, Highlanders and Chosen of Ishernos (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

Physical Resistance: +10% for Warbands, Oathsworn, Highlanders and Chosen of Ishernos (Rank 7 and above)
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: A mighty Warcrie at the right time can motivate warriors to fight harder and with renewed tenacity.
Those who know the land and its secrets will travel faster and further than the foes who don't.
Through our acts, the gods will cleanse the lands.
As an expert in such matters, it is their duty to know the king's law and to mete justice in his name.
"The land from here to the sea is yours, if you enforce the king's will."
Revered by the masses, such a celebrated leader will inspire many new recruits.
It is said that Sigmar would bear a mortal wound and carry on fighting; this champion follows the hallowed Warrior-God.

effects.description:
Casualty replenishment rate: +30% for this Lord
	(Lord's army)

skillTree.localised_description: "The time to strike is now!"

effects.description: Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +250 metres without incurring any time penalty
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +600 metres without incurring any time penalty
Enables lightning strike battles when reinforcements are present
Reinforcements supporting this army can have their arrival point adjusted by +1000 metres without incurring any time penalty

skillTree.localised_description: Proficient with figures, this Lord, or his subordinates, can keep his army fulfilled, even in dire circumstances.
Often outnumbered and outmatched in terms of individual strength, the warriors of Albions are skilled ambushers.
Countless conflicts and a keen sense of awareness have made this Lord difficult to entrap.

effects.description: Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +5%
Chance of intercepting an army using Tunnelling, beast-paths or Worldroots: +10%

skillTree.localised_description: This Lord's many deeds - both on and off the battlefield - have brought them renown among their allies and made them feared by their enemies.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +25% chance of wounding aggressors

attributes.bullet_text: This unit provides a leadership bonus to nearby allies. Units within range of both the Lord's aura and an encouraging unit will receive the larger of the two bonuses.
This unit can hide in forests until enemy units get too close.

enabled_if: Leadership is higher than 50% of base
Winds of magic power is 15 or greater

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Being fleet of foot is useful in a fight… or when trying to get away afterwards!

related_attributes.bullet_text: Speed and combat penalties caused by terrain are ignored by this unit.

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Deceit is a perfectly acceptable means of attack.

effects.description:
Ambush success chance: +10%
	(armies in local owned region)

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Having a modicum of resolve is useful in a world that continually tests it.

related_attributes.bullet_text: The unit is immune to psychological attacks (Fear & Terror).

backgroundSkills.localised_description: Self-belief is a fine thing when not misplaced.
Always in control, this one leaves no stone unturned and nothing to chance.
Although actually reading minds is not in their skillset, this one has extraordinary insight into the motives of others.

effects.description: Magic item drop chance from battle: +15%

backgroundSkills.localised_description: If you're gonna die, you may as well die with your boots on.
Rugged, resistant, and almost unbreakable, this being can and will take on all comers.
If you can swing, slash, stab, gouge, or shoot it, this warrior has mastered every aspect of its use.
This being has a plan - not just a game plan, but a master plan to achieve their long-term aims.
Careful planning, knowledge of the terrain and the weaknesses of the enemy are the key to victory.
What this being doesn't know probably isn't worth knowing, so deep is their interest in the world and its ways.
Sharp minds make sharp blades sharper still.

effects.description: Hero self-defence: +5% chance of wounding aggressors

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Druids are not only mages, but also religious leaders. This one follows Ishernos, the goddess of the earth.
The Druids are not only mages, but also religious leaders. This one follows Choteich, the god of the sun.

ui_effects.localised_text: Requires line of sight to the target

backgroundSkills.localised_description: The Druids are not only mages, but also religious leaders. This one follows Carnuos, the god of the hunt.
